page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: For years farmers in the area have grown{Brussels Sprouts}which were once a market garden crop. The sprouts were picked by itinerant and local labour and marketed fairly close to the area. Nowadays the large grower of sprouts has his own packhouse and prepares retail packs for the supermarket trade.He also sells through farming co-operatives at Littleton and Cheltenham as well as on the open market and to private dealers. {Winter cabbage}is grown in the area mainly Savoy and January King as well as about 50 acres of Spring and 30 acres of Summer cabbage. {Potatoes}are grown by only two farmers in the area who have a combined acreage of 50.{Tomatoes and {Capsicums.}About an acre and a half acre are grown under glass. These are marketed or sold locally to the shops.
